{"blocks":[{"key":"39ksp","text":"This protocols is part of the ANU Biosecurity mini-research project #1 "Plant Pathogen Diagnostics: Visuals, subcultures, and genomics". ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1belr","text":"
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dv067","text":"You will be provided four pots of 3-4 week old wheat plants that have been infected with different wheat pathogens. Each pot has been infected with one major pathogen. You will not know which pot has been infected with which pathogen. However, you will be provided a compendium of 10-15 wheat pathogens that will guide you to identify the infective agent for each treatment group. The fifth treatment group will be uninfected wheat plants which will be clearly identified. You can use treatment group #5 as negative control for your experiments.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d7f6d","text":"
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"109ik","text":"In total, each group will obtain five pots each:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1qhbs","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"dlrgp","text":"This specific protocol describes the molecular biology and a step-by-step guide for PCR barcoding of the Internal Transcribed Spacer, ITS using primers that contain barcodes, followed by ligation based amplicon sequencing with Nanopore. The initial steps of repeated PCR with high-fidelity polymerase and purification of the PCR amplicons has been performed by your demonstrator due to time limitations. We selected DNA samples of three research groups in week 5 so that we have three replicates per treatment group. This gives us 15 PCR reactions plus 1 negative control. We skip the extraction control for this practical mini-research project. This is step 1 of the protocol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"25li2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fkpml","text":"One group will perform the library preparation on the PCR barcoded and equimolar pooled amplicons. Most of the class need not be present for this library preparation [Step 2] but will join in for loading the final library and starting sequencing runs. We will also explain more about the theory during the lab. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fhl9d","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e44o","text":"This protocol is applicable for week 6. {"blocks":[{"key":"4k2js","text":"This protocol describes how to carry out native barcoding of PCR amplicons that already contain barcodes using the Ligation Sequencing Kit (SQK-RBKLSK114). The PCR barcoding allows for 10-100,000 barcoded samples to be sequenced in one reaction. We will barcode 16 PCR amplicons
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"br1h7","text":"This approach is recommended for users who:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"v7pl","text":"wish to multiplex 10 to 10,000 samples to reduce sequencing cost per sample","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5d65m","text":"want to avoid costly (time and money) native barcoding reactions and two step PCR barcoding reactions","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"447c0","text":"want to conserve amplicon length ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"afpid","text":"
As always you need to bring a lab notebook, a printed version of this protocol, and a pen to record your adventures in the lab.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b4v1q","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"csehh","text":"You must have read, understood, and follow the health and safety instructions provided in the "Overview Mini-Research Project #1 BIOL3106/6106" provided on Wattle (ANU learning portal). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2mdc0","text":"
You must have signed and returned one copy of the "Student Safety Declaration Form For Practical Class Work" before starting any laboratory work. These Hazard Sheets are provided on Wattle as part of the  "Overview Mini-Research Project #1 BIOL3106/6106" document.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

We selected three research groups so that we have three replicates per treatment group. This gives us 15 PCR reactions plus 1 negative control. We skip the extraction control for this practical mini-research project.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a364m","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2c0p","text":"We repeated the PCR like here PCR reaction of marker regions (a.k.a metabarcodes) (protocols.io) for these samples with the two following adjustments:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":30,"length":66}],"data":{}},{"key":"3rm67","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"47qae","text":"We used proof-reading high fidelity polymerase like Q5 for the PCR reaction.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"92pfc","text":"We used ITS primers that directly include DNA barcodes as follows, where N15-16 represents a unique barcode sequence","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":74,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4pkrt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2h8mr","text":"ITSFor (a.k.a. ITS1-F_KYO2_BARCODE): 5'-N15-16-TAGAGGAASTAAAAGTCGTAA-3'","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":41,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6o0mu","text":"ITSRev (a.k.a.LR6_BARCODE): 5'-N15-16-CGCCAGTTCTGCTTACC-3'","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":32,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6aj88","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"24rrm","text":"The PCR products were checked by agarose gel electrophoresis. These confirmed PCR products were then treated as follows.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"51CDFC60DE7311EEA7150A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.protocols.io/view/pcr-reaction-of-marker-regions-a-k-a-metabarcodes-8epv5x85jg1b/v1"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6vq2s","text":"Purify your PCR amplicons with magnetic beads (e.g. AMPure) by adding an equal volume of magnetic beads to the PCR reaction. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1gssk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"25adc","text":"For example if your PCR reaction was 50 ul add 50 ul of beads.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"atpvj","text":"Incubate while rotating the tube for 10 minutes at room temperature","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cigd0","text":"Spin down the sample and pellet on a magnet. Keep the tube on the magnet, and pipette off the supernatant.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"biuvf","text":"Keep the tube on the magnet and wash the beads with 200 ul of freshly prepared 80% ethanol without disturbing the pellet. Remove the ethanol using a pipette and discard.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1aebo","text":"These steps will be performed by a single group we selected in week 5. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"30b8t","text":"In a 0.2 ml thin-walled PCR tube, mix the following:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d4uvk","text":"\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ik1j","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fogrf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{},"colTitles":["Input Material","Volume [ul]"],"colWidths":[100,100],"data":[["Pooled purified PCR amplicons (~400 ng)","50"],["Ultra II End-prep Reaction Buffer","7"],["Ultra II End-prep Enzyme Mix","3"],["Total","60"]],"guid":"6F60233D8AAD454DA412DFBD31D48DAB","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"33o9h","text":"Between each addition, pipette mix 10-20 times.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mergeCells":{},"printData":[["Pooled purified PCR amplicons (~400 ng)","50"],["Ultra II End-prep Reaction Buffer","7"],["Ultra II End-prep Enzyme Mix","3"],["Total","60"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23]}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bdk7","text":"Thoroughly mix the reaction by gently pipetting and briefly spinning down.\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8gt6j","text":"Program the thermal cycler:  20°C for 5 minutes and 65°C for 5 minutes. Ramp it up and keep it at 20°C so we can start the program immediately. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1alr4","text":"Incubate the tubes at 20°C for 5 minutes and 65°C for 5 minutes using the PCR machine we already set up. Once done, briefly put the tubes  on ice to cool.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"n0tc","text":"Resuspend the magentic beads for DNA binding by vortexing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cgi59","text":"Add an equal volume of 60 ul of magnetic beads to End-prep reaction.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ctoho","text":"Incubate while rotating the tube with your hand for 5 minutes at room temperature","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6mp8f","text":"Spin down the sample and pellet on a magnet. Keep the tube on the magnet, and pipette off the supernatant.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"egs00","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5qrvs","text":"A demonstrator will help you with this step.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c6h0d","text":"Keep the tube on the magnet and wash the beads with 200ul of freshly prepared 80% ethanol without disturbing the pellet. Remove the ethanol using a pipette and discard.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"diqas","text":"Repeat the previous step 2.9.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7djuu","text":"Briefly spin down and place the tube back on the magnet. Pipette off any residual ethanol. Allow to dry for 1 - 2 mins, but do not dry the pellet to the point of cracking","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fsl5c","text":"Remove the tube from the magnetic rack and resuspend the pellet in 61 μl nuclease free water.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"c5u5e","text":"Incubate for 3 minutes while warming the tube with your fingers.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9uvb0","text":"Pellet the beads on a magnet until the eluate is clear and colourless, for at least 1 minute.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dnefd","text":"Remove and retain the full volume of eluate into a clean 1.5ml Eppendorf PCR tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4lsaj","text":"Now we will add the sequence adapters to the End-prepped PCR amplicons","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"55ssu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aa0bg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3cmt3","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4s5ak","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{},"colTitles":["Input Material\n","Volume [ul]"],"colWidths":[100,100],"data":[["End-prepped PCR amplicons","60"],["Ligation Buffer (LNB)","25"],["NEBNext Quick T4 DNA Ligase","10"],["Ligation Adapter (LA)","5"],["Total","100"]],"guid":"E6C4B1277D064B41AA7B0B6D13E017AC","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"44abd","text":"Between each addition, pipette mix 10-20 times.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mergeCells":{},"printData":[["End-prepped PCR amplicons","60"],["Ligation Buffer (LNB)","25"],["NEBNext Quick T4 DNA Ligase","10"],["Ligation Adapter (LA)","5"],["Total","100"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23,23]}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"84orl","text":"Thoroughly mix the reaction by gently pipetting and briefly spinning down.\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5vjvt","text":"Add 55 µl of resuspended magnetic beads to the reaction and mix by flicking the tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"37tm","text":"Incubate while rotating the tube with your hand for 5 minutes at room temperature","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f8dqv","text":"Spin down the sample and pellet on a magnet. Keep the tube on the magnet, and pipette off the supernatant.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4k658","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cinso","text":"A demonstrator will help you with this step.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7562q","text":"Wash the beads by adding 250 μl Short Fragment Buffer (SFB). Flick the beads to resuspend, spin down, then return the tube to the magnetic rack and allow the beads to pellet. Remove the supernatant using a pipette and discard.\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4gjni","text":"These steps will be performed by one group member while the rest of the class is watching.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fkob7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"pccm","text":"If you are not familiar with MinION flowcells check out this explanation video here Community - Flow cell introduction (nanoporetech.com). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":84,"length":53}],"data":{}},{"key":"9tt2v","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2lmg2","text":"This is a useful video for flowcell priming and loading Community - Priming and loading your flow cell (nanoporetech.com).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":56,"length":65}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"7F267FB8DDC811EE9F470A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://community.nanoporetech.com/nanopore_learning/lessons/flow-cell-introduction"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"5FF94D4CDDCC11EE9F470A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://community.nanoporetech.com/nanopore_learning/lessons/priming-and-loading-your-flow-cell"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8cfk8","text":"IMPORTANT","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c4fuk","text":"Take care when drawing back buffer from the flow cell. Introducing air bubbles into the array can irreversibly damage pores.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2abgm","text":"After opening the priming port, check for a small air bubble under the cover. Draw back a small volume to remove any bubbles:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2p4ik","text":"Set a P1000 pipette to 200 μl","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c5ios","text":"Insert the tip into the priming port","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"32q35","text":"Turn the wheel until the dial shows 220-230 ul, to draw back 20-30 ul, or until you can see a small volume of buffer entering the pipette tip.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8vojk","text":"\nNote: Visually check that there is continuous buffer from the priming port across the sensor array.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"96cml","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1kso6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"58u1c","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"69ug6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"height":248,"id":451085,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":null,\"entityMap\":null}","mime":"image/png","originalFile":{},"original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/p2srb5nw.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/p2spb5nw.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/p2sqb5nw.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/p2snb5nw.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9ot48","text":"The demonstrators will help setting up the sequencing runs. We will perform basecalling later on.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8k3e6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1gjrq","text":"Here is a list of useful videos:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bs5m1","text":"Introduction to the MinKNOW graphic user interface Community - MinKNOW: The graphical user interface (GUI) (nanoporetech.com)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":51,"length":74}],"data":{}},{"key":"f8aoo","text":"How to set up a sequencing experiment Community - MinKNOW: Setting up a new experiment (nanoporetech.com)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":38,"length":67}],"data":{}},{"key":"361mr","text":"How to assess your run is going fine Community - MinKNOW: Assessing your run (nanoporetech.com)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":37,"length":58}],"data":{}},{"key":"94nag","text":"How MinKNOW selects the best channels Community - MinKNOW: Mux scan and active channel selection (nanoporetech.com)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":38,"length":77}],"data":{}},{"key":"22f7a","text":"More about checking on if your sequencing run is going smoothly Community - MinKNOW: Pore occupancy (nanoporetech.com)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":4,"offset":64,"length":54}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"E1494862DDCC11EE9F470A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://community.nanoporetech.com/nanopore_learning/lessons/minknow-the-graphical-user-interface-gui"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"F0D3F1DCDDCC11EE9F470A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://community.nanoporetech.com/nanopore_learning/lessons/minknow-setting-up-a-new-experiment"}},"2":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"0706DCACDDCD11EE9F470A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://community.nanoporetech.com/nanopore_learning/lessons/minknow-assessing-your-run"}},"3":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"1850DF8DDDCD11EE9F470A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://community.nanoporetech.com/nanopore_learning/lessons/mux-scan-and-acs"}},"4":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"32095CFEDDCD11EE9F470A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://community.nanoporetech.com/nanopore_learning/lessons/minknow-pore-occupancy"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3qov2","text":"We will share sequencing results and initial analysis beginning of week 7. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"87bc0","text":"Repeat the previous step 1.4.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7hh3t","text":"Pellet the beads on a magnet until the eluate is clear and colourless, for at least 1 minute.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"564cs","text":"Incubate for 10 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9p7j6","text":"Remove the tube from the magnetic rack and resuspend the pellet in 20 ul of nuclease free water.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dg6dv","text":"Briefly spin down and place the tube back on the magnet. Pipette off any residual ethanol. Allow to dry for 1 - 2 mins, but do not dry the pellet to the point of cracking.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ao8u8","text":"Now we need to combine the 16 purified PCR amplicons [3 reps * 5 treatment groups + 1 negative PCR control] at equal molar ratios. We need about 400 ng DNA in total as input for the library prep as this equates to ~ 0.2 pmol when assuming an average long-ITS PCR amplicon length of 3000 bp.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1eu7e","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6moen","text":"This implies that we need to combine 25 ng per purified PCR amplicon and make it up to 50 ul total. These 50 ul contain our PCR amplicons in equal molar ratios and are the staring point for our library preparations.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7avl7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c2fe7","text":"To note is that we expect very low amounts for the negative PCR control and that it is best add as much as possible up to 25 ng to the DNA amplicon pool.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a64s4","text":"Quantify 1ul of purified amplicon using Qubit BR as described in previous protocols. Note down the concentration.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9pavv","text":"Remove and retain the full volume of eluate into a clean 200ul PCR tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"21gia","text":"Remove the tube from the magnetic rack and resuspend the pellet in 15 µl Elution Buffer (EB). Spin down and incubate for 5 minutes at room temperature.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"drqe7","text":"Repeat the previous step 2.22.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"fhe44","text":"Incubate the reaction for 10 minutes at room temperature.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"aspd","text":"Quantify 1ul of purified amplicon using Qubit BR as described in previous protocols. Note down the concentration and calculate the volume you need to obtain 20 fmol assuming an average amplicon length of ~ 3000 bp.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9oldh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"k3ac","text":"Remember:\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d5dg8","text":"n = c*V with n being the amount in ng, c the concentration in ng/ul, and V the volume in ul.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8cqc4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9iuiv","text":"and use the following online calculator.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cnssd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"17mve","text":"Biomath Calculators | DNA Calculator | Vector Insert Ratio (promega.com.au)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":75}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"83CD39C7DE7911EEA7150A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.promega.com.au/resources/tools/biomath"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dlhll","text":"Pellet the beads on a magnet until the eluate is clear and colourless, for at least 1 minute.\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"68fb4","text":"Remove and retain 15 µl of eluate containing the DNA library into a clean 1.5 ml Eppendorf DNA LoBind tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7eip0","text":"We now have our library ready to load and will wait for the rest of the class to come in.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3q1hq","text":"Add 37.5 uL of Sequencing Buffer (SB) and 25.5uL of Library Beads (LIB) to the sample.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3oq3f","text":"\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"emb33","text":"Note – the library beads settle on the bottom of the tube very quickly. Make sure to mix well before pipetting. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"647c6","text":"Make up 20 fmol of final library in 12 ul of Elution Buffer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"215sg","text":"This protocol does not require any hazardous substances.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8c8ik","text":"\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"v9iv","text":"You need to wear safety equipment at all times including lab coats, gloves, and safety goggles when handling chemicals and biological agents. While the major biological agents used for the wheat infection are pathogens commonly found in Australia, you must treat them as they were infective agents of general concern. Treat them with care. Do not remove them from the laboratory. Do not spread them via clothing. Use a dedicated notebook and pen to make notes during the mini-research project. Do not put anything into your mouth while in the laboratory. Wash your hands each time you leave the laboratory. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
